title: What is the answer to (a-b) (a+b) =? - Quora

response.answer_text: (a - b) (a + b) = a (a + b) - b (a + b) = a² + ab - (ab + b²) = a² + ab - ab - b² So, +ab and -ab will get cancelled. = a² - b² Therefore, (a - b) (a + b) = a² - b². Actually this is an identity in algebraic operations. I have shown you the method that how we will get a² - b² and the steps.👍☺️

Your question actually depends on which set a and b belongs to . If a and b belong to field F or any algebraic structure where ab =ba then (a-b)×(a+b) =a^2 -b^2 is right. But in case where ab!= ba then (a-b)×(a+b) =a^2+ab-ba-b^2.
